page.title: 11Farming at Ballantrae.
page.content: Commercial fleet-2 part time,2 full time 20'to 24'long clinker built boats Harbour is tidal so operating time is restricted.Bag and ring nets are used for salmon.Lobster creels are traditional Scottish old type. Long and small line fishing now mostly for home consumption.1985 salmon catch poor probably due to heavy rainfall giving fish easy access to Stinchar River and much sport for anglers.Fish netted often damaged by seals.Variety of species such as plaice,cod,skate, mackerel,flounder,crab provide sport fishing.Quota restricts herring catch. Porpoises,basking sharks often seen. Ballantrae remains a registration port using B.A.registration letters.A fishery protection vessel visits frequently.
